description: Business Case & Financial Justification draft using Problem-Agitate-Solve (PAS).

template.instruction: Act as a professional grant consultant. Draft the Business Case & Financial Justification section for an EDG proposal using the PAS framework. Cite evidence explicitly using [source:<section_id>] markers.

slots.problem: Summarize the company’s current pain points and weak financial position (from evidence).
slots.agitate: Explain why this creates risks for growth, competitiveness, or efficiency. Highlight urgency.
slots.solve: Present how the proposed project and vendor quotations solve these issues. Tie to expected ROI and KPIs.

input.company_context: SME in manufacturing with declining margins

examples.output: Problem: The SME’s audited financials show declining revenue over 3 years [source:audited_financials_2023]. Agitate: This trend threatens long-term competitiveness and reduces cash flow for reinvestment. Solve: By adopting the proposed consultancy scope [source:vendor_quotation], the SME expects a 20% improvement in process efficiency and ROI within 18 months.
